alert.note: Alert for Merrimack (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 16 at 6:03PM EDT until July 17 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New Hampshire, including the following counties, Belknap and Merrimack. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Waters are expected to rise to levels where basement flooding is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 601 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Laconia, Franklin, Belmont, Gilford, Tilton, Northfield and Sanbornton.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
